# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is how you can write the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    lines = String[]
    line_length = 0
    current_line = ""

    for word in split(s)
        if line_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
            line_length = length(word)
        else
            if line_length > 0
                current_line *= " "
                line_length += 1
            end
            current_line *= word
            line_length += length(word)
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)  # push the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a test of the text wrapping function in Julia."
println(wrap_string(text, 10))
```

In this example, `wrap_string` will break the input string `s` into lines such that no line exceeds `text_width` characters.
